title: Getting Forked by Microsoft
summary:
This article details the experience of a sole open-source maintainer ("I") whose Kubernetes image mirroring project, Spegel, was effectively forked by Microsoft to create Peerd. The author developed Spegel to address downtime issues in customer environments caused by image registry outages, offering a stateless and operationally light alternative to traditional mirroring.

Microsoft initially expressed interest in Spegel, leading to discussions and the author assisting Microsoft engineers with implementation. However, communication ceased, and later, the author discovered Microsoft had developed Peerd, a similar project, even referencing Spegel in its documentation. The author then found instances of copied code, including function signatures and comments, directly from Spegel within Peerd, with test cases that refer back to Spegel and the author's employer.

While Spegel was under the permissive MIT license, which allows forking and modifications, the author believes Microsoft did not properly attribute the original source in places. This situation has created confusion among users, making it challenging to promote Spegel alongside Microsoft's Peerd due to Microsoft's brand recognition. The author felt disheartened, questioning the value of continuing Spegel's development. Despite this, Spegel persists with significant community adoption. The author is now grappling with how independent open-source maintainers can collaborate with large corporations without being exploited. The author is also considering changing Spegel's license to a more restrictive one and has enabled GitHub sponsors to support the project's development.
chinese_title: 被微软分叉
chinese_summary:
本文详细描述了一位独立开源维护者（“我”）的经历，他的 Kubernetes 镜像镜像项目 Spegel 被微软实际性地 Fork 了，从而创建了 Peerd。作者开发 Spegel 是为了解决客户环境中因镜像仓库中断导致的停机问题，它提供了一种无状态且操作轻便的替代传统镜像方案。

微软最初对 Spegel 表示了兴趣，双方进行了讨论，作者还协助微软工程师进行实施。然而，沟通中断，后来，作者发现微软开发了 Peerd，一个类似的项目，甚至在其文档中引用了 Spegel。作者随后发现 Peerd 中直接复制了 Spegel 的代码，包括函数签名和注释，以及引用 Spegel 和作者雇主的测试用例。

虽然 Spegel 采用的是允许 Fork 和修改的宽松 MIT 许可，但作者认为微软在某些地方没有正确地署名原始来源。这种情况在用户中造成了混乱，由于微软的品牌知名度，这使得与微软的 Peerd 一起推广 Spegel 变得具有挑战性。作者感到沮丧，质疑继续开发 Spegel 的价值。尽管如此，Spegel 仍然存在，并获得了重要的社区采用。作者现在正在努力思考独立开源维护者如何在不被利用的情况下与大型公司合作。作者还在考虑将 Spegel 的许可证更改为更严格的许可证，并启用了 GitHub 赞助商来支持该项目的开发。

title: Why LLM-Powered Programming Is More Mech Suit Than Artificial Human
summary:
In his article "Why LLM-Powered Programming Is More Mech Suit Than Artificial Human," Matthew Sinclair argues that LLMs like Claude Code aren't replacing programmers but augmenting their abilities, much like Ripley's Power Loader in Aliens. He recounts using Claude Code to build two applications, generating 30k lines of code, and emphasizes the need for constant vigilance and human oversight.

While LLMs drastically reduce coding time, particularly in implementation ("How am I going to do it?"), the crucial "Why" and "What" stages remain vital and even increase in importance. Programmers must be willing to scrap AI-generated code ruthlessly when it's not aligned with the project's architectural goals.

Sinclair stresses that experience remains critical. Skilled developers can identify AI-generated nonsense and prevent it from causing problems. He draws a parallel to "Centaur chess," where human-AI teams outperform both humans and AI alone. The human provides strategic direction and judgment, while the AI offers computational power.

Effective collaboration with LLMs requires a balance between delegation and control. The future favors developers who can master these tools, recognizing both their potential and limitations, and using them to enhance, rather than replace, human skills in software development. The key takeaway is that architectural thinking, pattern recognition, and technical judgment become even more valuable in this new paradigm.
chinese_title: 为什么LLM驱动的编程更像是机甲战衣而非人造人
chinese_summary:
在他的文章《为什么LLM驱动的编程更像是机甲战衣而非人工智能人》中，Matthew Sinclair 认为像Claude Code这样的LLM并没有取代程序员，而是增强了他们的能力，就像《异形》中里普利的动力装甲一样。他讲述了使用 Claude Code 构建两个应用程序，生成 3 万行代码的经历，并强调了持续警惕和人工监督的必要性。

虽然LLM大幅缩短了编码时间，尤其是在实现阶段（“我该怎么做？”），但至关重要的“为什么”和“是什么”阶段仍然至关重要，甚至变得更加重要。程序员必须愿意无情地放弃与项目架构目标不符的AI生成的代码。

Sinclair 强调经验仍然至关重要。 熟练的开发人员可以识别 AI 生成的胡说八道，并防止它导致问题。他将这种情况比作“人机混合国际象棋”，在其中，人类与 AI 的团队表现优于人类或 AI 单独的表现。人类提供战略方向和判断，而 AI 提供计算能力。

与 LLM 的有效协作需要在委托和控制之间取得平衡。未来青睐那些能够掌握这些工具的开发者，既认识到它们的潜力，也认识到它们的局限性，并利用它们来增强而非取代软件开发中的人类技能。 关键在于，在这种新的范式中，架构思维、模式识别和技术判断变得更有价值。

title: Show HN: Dia, an open-weights TTS model for generating realistic dialogue
summary:
Nari Labs introduces Dia, a 1.6B parameter open-weights text-to-speech (TTS) model that generates realistic dialogue, controllable by audio conditioning for emotion and tone. Dia can also produce nonverbal cues like laughter and coughing. The model weights and inference code are available on Hugging Face for research acceleration. A demo is provided comparing Dia to ElevenLabs Studio and Sesame CSM-1B.

Users can quickly get started with Dia by cloning the GitHub repository and running the `app.py` script to open a Gradio UI. The model can also be used as a Python library, with a PyPI package and CLI tool coming soon.

Dia requires a GPU (PyTorch 2.0+, CUDA 12.6) for optimal performance and around 10GB of VRAM. While real-time audio generation is possible on enterprise GPUs, older GPUs will experience slower inference speeds. Quantization and CPU support are planned for the future.

Dia is licensed under Apache 2.0, but comes with strict usage limitations. It's intended solely for research and educational use, and cannot be used for identity misuse, deceptive content creation, or illegal activities.

Future work includes Docker support, inference speed optimization, and memory efficiency improvements through quantization. Nari Labs welcomes contributions and acknowledges the Google TPU Research Cloud program, SoundStorm, Parakeet, and Descript Audio Codec for inspiration.

title: Adding keyword parameters to Tcl procs
summary:
This blog post details the author's implementation of keyword parameters for Tcl procs, a feature the author felt was lacking in the language despite its presence in standard Tcl commands. The author implemented a `proc*` command that extends the standard `proc` to allow for optional, named, and order-agnostic parameters, similar to Unix command-line options.

The `proc*` command pre-processes the arguments list, identifies flags and options, and generates code that parses the input arguments and sets the appropriate variables. The implementation also includes logic to disambiguate positional arguments from options based on their number.

The author uses a custom quasiquoting mechanism, `quasiquote`, built with string manipulation and regular expressions, to generate the final Tcl code for the proc. The `quasiquote` command allows for selective substitution and splicing within strings, enabling dynamic code generation. The author acknowledges the complexity and potential downsides of metaprogramming via regular expressions, but ultimately finds the solution effective.
chinese_title: 为Tcl过程添加关键字参数
chinese_summary:
该博文详细介绍了作者为Tcl过程实现的关键字参数，作者认为尽管标准Tcl命令中存在这种特性，但该语言仍然缺乏它。作者实现了一个`proc*`命令，扩展了标准的`proc`命令，允许使用可选的、命名的且顺序无关的参数，类似于Unix命令行选项。

`proc*`命令预处理参数列表，识别标志和选项，并生成代码来解析输入参数并设置相应的变量。该实现还包括根据参数数量来区分位置参数和选项的逻辑。

作者使用自定义的准引用机制`quasiquote`，通过字符串操作和正则表达式构建，来生成proc的最终Tcl代码。`quasiquote`命令允许在字符串中进行选择性替换和拼接，从而实现动态代码生成。作者承认通过正则表达式进行元编程的复杂性和潜在缺点，但最终认为该解决方案是有效的。

title: Out of the Fog
summary:
Camille Bromley's "Out of the Fog" explores the complex legacy of Operation Babylift, the mass evacuation and adoption of Vietnamese children to Western countries, primarily the US, during the fall of Saigon in 1975. While initially framed as a humanitarian "mission of mercy" rescuing vulnerable children from the horrors of war, the article reveals the problematic realities experienced by many adoptees.

The article highlights that many children weren't actually orphans and were separated from their families amidst the chaos. Adoption agencies sometimes prioritized placing children with Western families over ensuring the children's well-being and potential reunification with birth families, as illustrated by the story of Anh Thi Hoang Doan.

The narrative shifts from the initial "rescue" story to the challenges faced by adoptees growing up in foreign countries. These include grappling with identity, racism, abuse, and mental health issues. Many adoptees felt isolated and incomplete, disconnected from their heritage and struggling to find a sense of belonging.

The article emphasizes the importance of communities formed by adoptees, such as InterCountry Adoptee Voices and Adopted Vietnamese International, which provide crucial support, resources, and a sense of shared identity. These groups help adoptees navigate the complexities of their past, search for birth families, and address the lack of government support for transnational adoptees. It argues that the initial narrative of Operation Babylift as a simple act of charity overlooks the long-term, profound impacts on the lives of the children involved.
chinese_title: 拨云见日
chinese_summary:
卡米尔·布罗姆利的《走出迷雾》探讨了“婴儿空运行动”的复杂遗产。该行动是指1975年西贡陷落期间，将越南儿童大规模撤离并被西方国家（主要是美国）收养的事件。文章揭示了许多被收养者所经历的各种问题，与最初将其定义为从战争恐怖中拯救脆弱儿童的人道主义“慈悲行动”的说法相悖。

文章强调，许多儿童实际上并非孤儿，而是在混乱中与家人分离。收养机构有时优先考虑将儿童安置在西方家庭，而不是确保儿童的福祉和与亲生家庭的潜在团聚，Anh Thi Hoang Doan的故事就是一个例证。

叙事从最初的“拯救”故事转变为被收养者在国外长大所面临的挑战。这些挑战包括与身份认同、种族主义、虐待和心理健康问题作斗争。许多被收养者感到孤立和不完整，与他们的传统脱节，并努力寻找归属感。

文章强调了被收养者群体的重要性，例如“跨国被收养者之声”和“国际越南被收养者”，这些群体提供重要的支持、资源和共同身份感。这些团体帮助被收养者理清他们的过去，寻找亲生家庭，并解决政府对跨国被收养者缺乏支持的问题。文章认为，最初将“婴儿空运行动”描述为简单的慈善行为，忽略了对参与其中的儿童生活的长期而深刻的影响。

title: Python's new t-strings
summary:
This article introduces t-strings, a new feature in Python 3.14 (expected in late 2025) designed to enhance string processing safety and flexibility. T-strings, similar to JavaScript's tagged templates, are safer than f-strings when handling user input because they don't immediately evaluate into strings. Instead, they create `Template` objects, allowing developers or libraries to safely process and escape dynamic content before string conversion, preventing vulnerabilities like SQL injection and cross-site scripting.

The article explains how to work with t-strings, highlighting the `.strings` and `.values` properties for accessing the string segments and interpolated values, respectively. It also details how to iterate over a `Template` and access detailed interpolation information like conversion and formatting specifications.

A simple example demonstrates converting substituted words into pig latin using a custom function that iterates through the `Template`'s components. The author suggests t-strings are useful beyond safety, enabling flexible string processing where functions can return different types or accept useful substitutions.

The article concludes by expressing hope that the Python ecosystem will embrace t-strings, particularly in libraries and frameworks handling user input, and that tools like Black and Ruff will support formatting t-string content.
chinese_title: Python 的新型 t 字符串
chinese_summary:
本文介绍了 t-strings，这是 Python 3.14（预计于 2025 年末发布）中的一项新特性，旨在增强字符串处理的安全性和灵活性。T-strings 类似于 JavaScript 的标记模板，在处理用户输入时比 f-strings 更安全，因为它们不会立即求值为字符串。相反，它们创建 `Template` 对象，允许开发者或库在字符串转换之前安全地处理和转义动态内容，从而防止 SQL 注入和跨站脚本等漏洞。

本文解释了如何使用 t-strings，重点介绍了 `.strings` 和 `.values` 属性，分别用于访问字符串片段和插值。 它还详细介绍了如何迭代 `Template` 并访问详细的插值信息，如转换和格式化规范。

一个简单的例子演示了如何使用自定义函数将替换的单词转换为猪拉丁语，该函数迭代 `Template` 的组件。 作者认为 t-strings 的用途不仅限于安全性，还能实现灵活的字符串处理，其中函数可以返回不同的类型或接受有用的替换。

文章最后表达了希望 Python 生态系统能够拥抱 t-strings，尤其是在处理用户输入的库和框架中，并且 Black 和 Ruff 等工具将支持格式化 t-string 内容。

title: Tabular Programming: A New Paradigm for Expressive Computing
summary:
This article introduces Tabular Programming, a new programming paradigm designed for minimal, portable hardware interfaces inspired by the m8 Dirtywave tracker. The core idea is to organize code into structured tables with fixed columns: NAME, IN, EXP1-EXP5, and OUT, representing functions and their execution logic. The limited expression cells encourage function decomposition, leading to more maintainable code.

The proposed hardware would feature a Teensy 4.1 microcontroller, a small display, and 8 buttons for navigation and editing. This "selection rather than typing" approach aims to reduce errors and improve data flow visualization.

The author demonstrates the concept with demoscene examples like plasma and tunnel effects, highlighting how complex visuals can be created within the tabular structure and expression limitations. They explain how the stack-based virtual machine would execute the code, implicitly connecting operations within rows while function calls manage data flow between them.

Beyond demos, the author envisions applications like pixel art editors or music tools, designed around the constraints of the hardware for a more intuitive experience. A hierarchical organization model, inspired by the m8's "Views" and context-sensitive menus, would address scalability and ease of use. The key is creating an integrated hardware/software system where the constraints enhance, rather than limit, creative expression. A working web prototype exists to validate the core concepts.
chinese_title: 表格编程：一种表达性计算的新范式
chinese_summary:
本文介绍表格化编程，这是一种新的编程范式，其设计灵感来自m8 Dirtywave音序器，旨在实现极简、便携的硬件接口。核心思想是将代码组织成具有固定列（名称、输入、表达式1-表达式5和输出）的结构化表格，这些列代表函数及其执行逻辑。有限的表达式单元格鼓励函数分解，从而提高代码的可维护性。

拟议的硬件将配备Teensy 4.1微控制器、小型显示器和8个用于导航和编辑的按钮。“选择而非键入”的方法旨在减少错误并改善数据流可视化。

作者通过等离子和隧道效应等演示场景示例来展示该概念，突出显示了如何在表格结构和表达式限制内创建复杂的视觉效果。他们解释了基于堆栈的虚拟机将如何执行代码，隐式地连接行内的操作，而函数调用则管理它们之间的数据流。

除了演示之外，作者还设想了像素艺术编辑器或音乐工具等应用程序，这些应用程序是围绕硬件的约束而设计的，以获得更直观的体验。受m8的“视图”和上下文相关菜单启发的层级组织模型将解决可扩展性和易用性问题。关键是创建一个集成的硬件/软件系统，使约束增强而不是限制创造性表达。现有一个可用的Web原型来验证核心概念。

title: The Tontine Coffee-House (2018)
summary:
This article explores the history of the Tontine Coffee-House in New York City and its role in the development of the New York Stock Exchange. The coffee house, established in 1793-94, was funded by a "tontine," an archaic annuity-like investment scheme combining retirement planning with a lottery. Investors bought shares and received dividends until their death, with deceased investors' shares redistributed to the survivors, enriching those who lived longer.

The Tontine Coffee-House served as a central meeting place for brokers, traders, underwriters, and merchants. It facilitated trading and the dissemination of news, eventually evolving into a precursor to the New York Stock Exchange. The article highlights that the tontine which funded the coffee house sold 203 shares, which provided $40,000 in start-up capital, over 1 million in today's money.

The coffee house was located at the corner of Wall Street and Water Street. While the building was eventually demolished and replaced, trading moved to other locations, culminating in the New York Stock Exchange's present location. The tontine was wound down in 1870, with the remaining seven beneficiaries, mostly from wealthy families, enjoying significant benefits from their long-term investment. The article concludes by reflecting on the humble beginnings of the securities business in New York and suggesting a possible appreciation of 18th-century retirement planning.
chinese_title: 汤汀咖啡馆 (2018)
chinese_summary:
本文探讨了纽约通廷咖啡馆的历史及其在纽约证券交易所发展中的作用。该咖啡馆成立于1793-94年，由一种名为“通廷”的古老年金式投资计划资助，该计划将退休规划与彩票相结合。投资者购买股份并在去世前获得股息，已故投资者的股份重新分配给幸存者，使寿命较长的人受益。

通廷咖啡馆是经纪人、交易员、承销商和商人的中心聚会场所。它促进了交易和新闻传播，最终演变成纽约证券交易所的前身。文章强调，资助咖啡馆的通廷出售了203股，提供了4万美元的启动资金，相当于今天的100多万美元。

咖啡馆位于华尔街和水街的拐角处。虽然该建筑最终被拆除并重建，但交易转移到了其他地点，最终形成了纽约证券交易所现在的所在地。通廷于1870年结束，剩余的七名受益人，主要来自富裕家庭，从他们的长期投资中获得了可观的收益。文章最后反思了纽约证券业务的简陋开端，并提出了对18世纪退休规划的一种可能的欣赏。

title: Reworking 30 lines of Linux code could cut power use by up to 30 percent
summary: A computer science professor from the University of Waterloo, Martin Karsten, and his collaborators have discovered that reworking just 30 lines of Linux code can potentially cut data center power consumption by up to 30%. The inefficiency within the existing code has been identified and corrected, leading to significant energy savings. This simple fix could have a major impact on the energy footprint of data centers, offering a cost-effective and readily implementable solution to reduce their environmental impact. title: Haskelling My Python
summary:
This article demonstrates how to implement Haskell-style lazy infinite lists using Python generators. It starts by defining a recursive generator for positive integers (`ints()`) and a function `take()` to retrieve a limited number of elements from a generator.

The core concept revolves around using integration to define Taylor series as infinite generators. The author defines an `integrate()` function that shifts and divides the terms of a Taylor series, and then leverages the relationship between a function and its integral to define `expSeries()` (e^x), `sine()`, and `cosine()` recursively. This is possible because the generators produce elements lazily, only when requested.

The article then provides an `evalAt()` function to evaluate the Taylor series at a specific point and compares the results with Python's standard library functions (e.g., `math.exp()`, `math.sin()`).

Finally, the article addresses the performance issues with Python generators due to the lack of memoization (compared to Haskell lists) and potential recursion limits. It introduces a `memoize` decorator to cache the generator's results, significantly improving performance. The author also notes that the approach works with Python's `fractions` module for rational number results.
chinese_title: 用 Haskell 改造我的 Python

文章随后提供了一个 `evalAt()` 函数，用于在特定点评估泰勒级数，并将结果与 Python 的标准库函数（例如，`math.exp()`、`math.sin()`）进行比较。

最后，本文讨论了 Python 生成器由于缺乏记忆化（与 Haskell 列表相比）和潜在的递归限制而导致的性能问题。它引入了一个 `memoize` 装饰器来缓存生成器的结果，从而显著提高性能。作者还指出，该方法适用于 Python 的 `fractions` 模块，以获得有理数结果。

title: Reverse engineering the obfuscated TikTok VM
summary:
This article details the reverse engineering of TikTok's obfuscated Virtual Machine (VM), specifically found in `webmssdk.js`, used for security and obfuscation. The author outlines the deobfuscation process, starting with decoding string arrays and converting bracket notation to dot notation for readability. They then address the obfuscation of function calls by replacing array-indexed function calls with standard function calls using AST transformation via Babel.

The article discusses the deconstruction of the VM's bytecode, which is initially XOR-encrypted and gZip-compressed. The author describes decrypting the bytecode and decompiling the VM instructions, initially relying on AI assistance.

A key aspect is debugging the deobfuscated code by replacing the original `webmssdk.js` using browser extensions like Tampermonkey and CSP disabler. This allows for real-time editing and testing.

The author then dives into reverse engineering request signing, focusing on the `X-Bogus` and `_signature` headers required for making requests to TikTok servers. `X-Bogus` generation is achieved via `window.frontierSign` while `_signature` requires deeper investigation into the VM. They reverse engineered VM functions like VM86, VM113 (X-Bogus), and VM189 (_signature) and implemented a signer capable of generating valid signatures, enabling actions like posting comments. The article acknowledges the presence of client-side bot protection measures, such as mouse tracking, which are not server-validated and can be ignored for signature generation. Finally, the author notes that the TikTok VM is constantly evolving, requiring continuous decompilation efforts.

title: Coding Neon Kernels for the Cortex-A53
summary:
This article delves into the intricacies of optimizing NEON kernels for the ARM Cortex-A53 processor, focusing on achieving maximum performance for a simple linear math operation: `y[n] = ax[n] + b`. The author highlights the challenges stemming from the lack of publicly available documentation on the A53's instruction timings, relying instead on community-sourced information and micro-benchmarking.

Key aspects of the A53 discussed include its in-order execution, partial dual-issue capabilities, and the asymmetry in its load (64-bit) and store (128-bit) data paths. The article emphasizes that understanding these characteristics is crucial for hand-optimizing assembly code, as the CPU is sensitive to poorly ordered instructions. The author also warns against relying on `llvm-mca` for A53 optimization due to its inaccurate CPU model.

The article analyzes two approaches to calculate `y[n] = ax[n] + b`: using separate `fmul` and `fadd` instructions, and using the `fmla` instruction. Both approaches have similar performance. A theoretical analysis estimates a maximum throughput of one `y[n]` calculation per clock cycle (2 FLOPs/cycle). The author then demonstrates a practical approach using 64-bit NEON registers to match the load data path's width, allowing dual-issuing of load/store and math operations, ultimately striving to achieve the theoretical performance limit. The key is to overlap memory operations with calculations by operating on 64 bit vectors instead of 128 bit ones.

title: Decentralizing Schemes
summary:
Tim Bray argues that decentralized social media platforms like the Fediverse and Bluesky face usability challenges due to their decentralized nature. Specifically, he identifies "sharing pain," where users struggle to interact with content on different instances or through different clients; "client pain," where clicking a link opens the wrong application; and "post portability pain," where content hosted on defunct servers becomes inaccessible.

Bray proposes leveraging URI schemes (like `https:` or `mailto:`) to address these issues. He suggests defining schemes like `fedi:` for Fediverse and `at:` for ATproto, allowing operating systems and browsers to route links to the appropriate client applications. This would solve sharing and client pain by ensuring users can interact with content seamlessly, regardless of the instance or client used.

Furthermore, Bray envisions URI schemes enabling post portability. By using a `fedi:` URI, Fediverse software could track account migrations and retrieve posts from old servers, even if they are no longer active. While acknowledging existing challenges, like patchy browser support, Bray emphasizes that URI schemes are a foundational Web technology designed for protocol support and multiple implementations, making them a promising solution for improving the user experience of decentralized social media. He also notes that Android already has some support for handling new URI schemes.

title: Things Zig comptime won't do
summary:
This article discusses the limitations of Zig's `comptime` feature, highlighting what it *won't* do, despite its power. The author argues that these restrictions are intentional and contribute to Zig's design principles.

Key limitations include:

*   **No Host Leakage:** `comptime` code doesn't access host architecture details, ensuring consistent behavior across different compilation targets (cross-compilation). This prevents unintended dependencies on the machine used for compilation.

*   **No `#eval`:** Zig doesn't allow dynamic source code generation by injecting arbitrary strings during compilation. Instead, it uses partial evaluation/specialization, where functions or control flow expressions can be partially evaluated at compile time if certain arguments are `comptime`-known.

*   **No DSLs:** Zig lacks extension points for custom syntax. Everything operates on Zig values, though custom syntax can still be passed as `comptime` strings (like in `printf`).

*   **No RTTI:** While `comptime` allows type-based specialization (similar to dynamic languages), Zig doesn't retain runtime type information. If runtime type information is needed, it must be explicitly created and passed as runtime values.

*   **No New API:** While `comptime` can generate new types, it cannot add methods to those types. APIs must be hand-written, though they can use `comptime` reflection internally. Libraries can't automatically add methods (e.g., `.to_json`) to user-defined types.

*   **No IO:** `comptime` code cannot perform any input/output operations. This guarantees hermetic, reproducible, safe, and cacheable compile-time evaluation. Database interactions, if needed, should be handled by the build system (`build.zig`) to generate Zig code.

The author concludes that these limitations, although restrictive, lead to a cleaner and more manageable meta-programming system, balancing power with ease of reasoning.
chinese_title: Zig编译时不能做的事情
chinese_summary:
Zig `comptime` 功能的局限性：它 *不会* 做什么

主要局限性包括：

*   **无宿主泄漏：** `comptime` 代码不访问宿主架构细节，确保跨不同编译目标（交叉编译）的一致行为。这可以防止对用于编译的机器的意外依赖。

*   **无 `#eval`：** Zig 不允许通过在编译期间注入任意字符串来动态生成源代码。相反，它使用部分求值/特化，如果某些参数是 `comptime` 已知的，则可以在编译时部分求值函数或控制流表达式。

*   **无 DSL：** Zig 缺乏用于自定义语法的扩展点。一切都基于 Zig 值运行，尽管自定义语法仍然可以作为 `comptime` 字符串传递（例如在 `printf` 中）。

*   **无 RTTI：** 虽然 `comptime` 允许基于类型的特化（类似于动态语言），但 Zig 不保留运行时类型信息。如果需要运行时类型信息，则必须显式创建并作为运行时值传递。

*   **无新 API：** 虽然 `comptime` 可以生成新类型，但它不能向这些类型添加方法。API 必须手动编写，尽管它们可以在内部使用 `comptime` 反射。库不能自动向用户定义的类型添加方法（例如，`.to_json`）。

*   **无 IO：** `comptime` 代码不能执行任何输入/输出操作。这保证了封闭的、可重现的、安全的和可缓存的编译时求值。如果需要数据库交互，应由构建系统 (`build.zig`) 处理以生成 Zig 代码。

作者总结说，这些限制虽然具有约束性，但会带来更清晰、更易于管理的元编程系统，在强大功能和易于推理之间取得平衡。

title: Experimenting is above all a process
summary:

Published on January 4, 2025, and categorized as a Case Study, the 1973-word piece by Rémi Forte likely delves into the intricacies and best practices for conducting effective experiments.

Based on the title, the article likely argues that the success of experimentation relies heavily on the establishment and adherence to a clear, well-defined process. This process likely includes stages such as:

*   **Defining clear objectives and hypotheses:** Establishing what the experiment aims to achieve and formulating testable predictions.
*   **Designing a rigorous methodology:** Ensuring the experiment is structured to isolate variables, control for biases, and gather reliable data.
*   **Executing the experiment effectively:** Implementing the designed methodology consistently and accurately.
*   **Analyzing the results comprehensively:** Interpreting the collected data, identifying significant findings, and drawing meaningful conclusions.
*   **Iterating based on the findings:** Using the results to refine the process, adjust hypotheses, and plan future experiments.

Therefore, the core message of the article is likely that approaching experimentation with a process-oriented mindset is crucial for achieving valid, reliable, and actionable results. The Case Study format suggests it will provide real-world examples and insights to support this claim.

title: Gemma 3 QAT Models: Bringing AI to Consumer GPUs
summary:
This Google Developers Blog post announces the release of Quantization-Aware Training (QAT) optimized versions of the Gemma 3 open models. These new versions significantly reduce memory requirements, enabling them to run on consumer-grade GPUs like the NVIDIA RTX 3090, bringing state-of-the-art AI to more accessible hardware.

The article highlights the importance of accessibility, noting that while high-end hardware is great for cloud deployments, many users want to leverage Gemma 3's power on their existing hardware. QAT achieves this by reducing the precision of the model's parameters (quantization), leading to smaller model sizes and lower VRAM requirements. For example, the Gemma 3 27B model's VRAM requirement drops from 54GB (BF16) to 14.1GB (int4).

The blog post explains how QAT works, emphasizing that it integrates the quantization process during training to minimize performance degradation. The post then details how this enables running Gemma 3 models on various devices, including desktops, laptops, and even phones. Integration with popular tools like Ollama, LM Studio, MLX, Gemma.cpp, and llama.cpp is also emphasized.

The article also mentions the availability of Post-Training Quantization (PTQ) alternatives from the community. The post concludes by encouraging developers to explore the quantized models and begin building, with links to resources like Hugging Face, Kaggle, and Google AI Edge.

title: The effect of deactivating Facebook and Instagram on users' emotional state
summary:
This NBER working paper, "The Effect of Deactivating Facebook and Instagram on Users’ Emotional State," investigates the impact of social media deactivation on users' mental well-being. Researchers conducted two large randomized experiments before the 2020 U.S. election, examining the effects of deactivating Facebook and Instagram for six weeks.

The study found that deactivating Facebook for six weeks led to a statistically significant 0.060 standard deviation improvement in an index measuring happiness, depression, and anxiety, compared to a control group that deactivated for only one week. Similarly, deactivating Instagram for the same period resulted in a 0.041 standard deviation improvement in the same index.

Further exploratory analysis revealed potential demographic nuances: the positive effect of Facebook deactivation was primarily observed among individuals over 35, while the positive effect of Instagram deactivation was more pronounced among women under 25.

The paper acknowledges potential conflicts of interest, listing numerous authors who have received funding, travel, or consulting fees from Meta (Facebook) or related companies, held Meta stock, or were past employees of Meta. The study provides links to the data appendix and randomized controlled trials registry entry for further scrutiny.

进一步的探索性分析揭示了潜在的人口统计学差异： Facebook 停用的积极影响主要在 35 岁以上的人群中观察到，而 Instagram 停用的积极影响在 25 岁以下的女性中更为明显。

title: Crows can recognize geometric regularity
summary:
This Science X Network article reports on a study published in *Science Advances* that demonstrates carrion crows can recognize geometric regularity. Researchers at the University of Tübingen, Germany, conducted experiments where crows were trained to identify an "intruder" shape within a group of shapes presented on a computer screen, receiving a food treat for correct choices.

The study revealed that crows could distinguish shapes differing in geometric properties, like a star among rectangles. Further tests indicated the crows had an understanding of right angles, parallel lines, and symmetry. Even when the differences between the shapes were subtle, the crows performed significantly better than chance.

This finding is significant because, prior to this study, recognizing geometric regularity was thought to be a uniquely human ability. The researchers believe the crows' performance, achieved without prior training, strongly suggests this ability may exist in other animal species as well. The study utilized both non-quadrilateral and quadrilateral shapes in its testing, carefully designing the latter to vary in geometric properties like parallelism and symmetry to assess the crows' ability to recognize subtle differences in regularity.

title: TikZJax: Embedding LaTeX Drawings in HTML
summary:
TikZJax is a JavaScript library that allows embedding LaTeX TikZ drawings directly into HTML pages, converting them into SVGs. It works entirely within the browser. To use it, one needs to include the necessary CSS and JavaScript files from the TikZJax website in the HTML `<head>`. Then, TikZ code can be placed within `<script type="text/tikz">` tags in the `<body>`. TikZJax automatically compiles this code and replaces the script tag with the generated SVG image. The article demonstrates this with examples showing the creation of a circle and a commutative diagram.

The core technology enabling TikZJax involves compiling the Pascal source code of TeX to WebAssembly using web2js. A minimal LaTeX format is loaded, followed by the execution of a specific LaTeX preamble for TikZ. The resulting core is then dumped, compressed, and reloaded in the browser, allowing for fast execution of TikZ code. Using an SVG driver for PGF, along with dvi2html, the DVI output is converted into an SVG image, all happening client-side.

title: How encryption for Cinema Movies works
summary:
This article provides an overview of how encryption works for cinema movies, focusing on the DCI (Digital Cinema Initiatives) standard. The DCI standard defines the file formats, encryption, and projection systems used in the cinema industry.

The author explores the distribution process, starting from the producer creating a DCP (Digital Cinema Package) and a DKDM (Distribution Key Delivery Message) containing an AES key encrypted with the distributor's certificate. The distributor then verifies the projector, creates a KDM (Key Delivery Message) for the cinema, and sends the DCP and KDM to the cinema. The projector uses the KDM to decrypt the DCP for playback.

The article describes the components of a projection system (server, media block, audio processor, projector), and explains that DCPs are stored encrypted and decrypted in real-time by the projector's media block. The structure of a DCP is detailed, including folder naming conventions, MXF files for video and audio, and subtitle formats. A supplemental DCP (VF) allows for replacing audio or subtitle tracks without duplicating the entire picture data.

The distribution process relies on certificate chains and the trusted device list. The AES key of the DCP is encrypted within the KDM using the projector's public key. The article outlines the steps involved in decrypting the KDM and validating its contents.

The author also touches on the challenges of building a custom DCI projector, noting that distributors rely on a "Trusted Device List" and authorized installations to prevent unauthorized playback. Finally, the article dives into the MXF file format, focusing on the BER encoding and the structure of a single movie frame triplet.

作者探讨了发行过程，从制片人创建DCP（数字电影包）和一个包含用发行商证书加密的AES密钥的DKDM（发行密钥传递消息）开始。然后，发行商验证投影机，为电影院创建一个KDM（密钥传递消息），并将DCP和KDM发送到电影院。投影机使用KDM解密DCP以进行播放。

本文描述了放映系统的组件（服务器、媒体块、音频处理器、投影机），并解释说DCP被加密存储，并由投影机的媒体块实时解密。DCP的结构得到了详细说明，包括文件夹命名约定、用于视频和音频的MXF文件和字幕格式。补充DCP（VF）允许替换音频或字幕轨道，而无需复制整个图像数据。

发行过程依赖于证书链和可信设备列表。DCP的AES密钥在使用投影机的公钥的KDM中进行加密。本文概述了解密KDM和验证其内容所涉及的步骤。

作者还谈到了构建定制DCI投影机的挑战，指出发行商依赖“可信设备列表”和授权安装来防止未经授权的播放。最后，本文深入探讨了MXF文件格式，重点介绍了BER编码和单个电影帧三元组的结构。

title: Jagged AGI: o3, Gemini 2.5, and everything after
summary:
Ethan Mollick's article "Jagged AGI: o3, Gemini 2.5, and everything after" explores the recent advancements in AI, particularly with the release of models like o3 and Gemini 2.5 Pro, and their implications for Artificial General Intelligence (AGI). Mollick notes the difficulty in defining and measuring AGI due to the limitations of existing tests designed for humans.

The article highlights Tyler Cowen's claim that o3 is AGI, referencing its enhanced capabilities demonstrated through examples like generating comprehensive marketing plans, performing geographic location guesses with web searches, and analyzing complex datasets. While impressed, Mollick introduces the concept of "Jagged AGI" to describe the uneven abilities of these AI systems, where they can excel in complex tasks but fail at simple ones, exemplified by the riddle-solving example.

Mollick questions whether these models truly represent AGI, given definitional issues and their unreliability in certain areas. Despite this, he acknowledges their potential to significantly impact work and life due to their "superhuman" abilities in specific tasks. He also examines whether AGI is just a gradual improvement of a technology.

The article concludes by considering the speed of AI adoption and integration into society. While historical trends suggest a slow diffusion process, Mollick raises the possibility that the agentic capabilities of models like o3 could accelerate this process. Ultimately, Mollick argues that navigating the "jagged landscape" of AI's capabilities will be crucial for adapting to whatever future AI advancements bring.
chinese_title: 锯齿状AGI：o3、Gemini 2.5及之后的一切
chinese_summary:
伊森·莫里克的文章《锯齿状AGI：o3、Gemini 2.5及未来》探讨了人工智能的最新进展，特别是o3和Gemini 2.5 Pro等模型的发布，以及它们对通用人工智能（AGI）的影响。莫里克指出，由于现有针对人类设计的测试的局限性，定义和衡量AGI存在困难。

文章重点介绍了泰勒·科文声称o3是AGI的观点，并引用了其增强的能力，例如生成全面的营销计划、通过网络搜索进行地理位置猜测以及分析复杂数据集。虽然印象深刻，莫里克引入了“锯齿状AGI”的概念来描述这些AI系统的不均衡能力，它们可以在复杂的任务中表现出色，但在简单的任务中失败，例如谜语解答的例子。

莫里克质疑这些模型是否真正代表AGI，因为存在定义问题以及它们在某些领域的不可靠性。尽管如此，他承认它们由于在特定任务中具有“超人”能力，因此有可能对工作和生活产生重大影响。他还探讨了AGI是否只是技术的逐步改进。

文章最后考虑了人工智能在社会中的采用和整合速度。尽管历史趋势表明扩散过程缓慢，但莫里克提出了o3等模型的代理能力可能会加速这一过程的可能性。最终，莫里克认为，驾驭人工智能能力的“锯齿状景观”对于适应未来人工智能的任何进步至关重要。

title: A New Form of Verification on Bluesky
summary:
Bluesky is introducing a new, multi-layered verification system to enhance user trust on its platform. In addition to the existing domain-as-username verification method (used by over 270,000 accounts), Bluesky is now adding a visible blue checkmark displayed next to the names of authentic and notable accounts, verified proactively by Bluesky.

Furthermore, Bluesky is empowering select, independent organizations to act as "Trusted Verifiers." These organizations can directly issue blue checkmarks (distinguished by a scalloped design) to accounts they trust, such as The New York Times verifying its journalists. Bluesky moderation still reviews these verifications for authenticity. Users can see which organization verified an account by tapping on the blue checkmark.

Users also have the option to hide all verification indicators within the app via settings.

Currently, Bluesky is not accepting direct applications for the new blue check verification. However, they encourage organizations and individuals to self-verify by setting their domain as their username. Bluesky plans to launch a request form for verification and Trusted Verifier applications once the new system stabilizes. The goal is to build trust through a combination of platform verification and community-based verification.
chinese_title: Bluesky上的新型验证方式
chinese_summary:
Bluesky推出全新多层验证系统，以增强平台用户信任度。除了现有的域名即用户名验证方法（已被超过27万个账号使用）外，Bluesky现新增由Bluesky主动验证的、在真实且知名账号名称旁显示的蓝色勾选标记。

此外，Bluesky授权精选的独立组织作为“可信验证者”。这些组织可以直接向其信任的账号（例如《纽约时报》验证其记者）颁发蓝色勾选标记（以扇形设计区分）。 Bluesky审核团队仍会审查这些验证的真实性。用户可以通过点击蓝色勾选标记查看验证该账号的组织。

用户还可以通过设置隐藏应用程序中的所有验证标识。

目前，Bluesky暂不接受直接申请新的蓝色勾选验证。但他们鼓励组织和个人通过将域名设置为用户名来进行自验证。 Bluesky计划在新系统稳定后推出验证和可信验证者申请表。目标是通过平台验证和社区验证相结合的方式建立信任。

title: Inside ArXiv
summary:
This article explores the history and impact of arXiv, a digital repository created by physicist Paul Ginsparg that revolutionized scientific publishing. ArXiv allows researchers to share their findings instantly as preprints, bypassing the lengthy peer-review process of traditional academic journals dominated by for-profit publishers. It has become an indispensable tool for scientists in mathematics, physics, and computer science, facilitating rapid dissemination of knowledge and fostering collaboration.

The article details Ginsparg's journey, from creating arXiv as a collection of shell scripts on his NeXT machine to its current status as a critical infrastructure hosting millions of papers. It highlights key moments, such as the early adoption by influential figures like Ed Witten, and the strategic decision to secure nonexclusive distribution rights, preventing publishers from shutting it down.

Despite its success, arXiv has faced challenges, including scaling issues, moderation of low-quality submissions, and bureaucratic hurdles. Ginsparg, described as a brilliant but unconventional character, remains deeply involved, constantly seeking ways to improve the platform, including developing a "crackpot filter" using AI. The article emphasizes arXiv's vital role in accelerating scientific progress, particularly during crises like the Covid-19 pandemic, and its continued relevance as a primary source for cutting-edge research.
chinese_title: 在ArXiv内部
chinese_summary:
本文探讨了由物理学家保罗·金斯帕格创建的数字存储库arXiv的历史和影响。arXiv彻底改变了科学出版，它允许研究人员以预印本的形式即时分享他们的研究成果，绕过了传统学术期刊中由营利性出版商主导的漫长同行评审过程。它已成为数学、物理学和计算机科学领域科学家的不可或缺的工具，促进了知识的快速传播和合作。

本文详细介绍了金斯帕格的历程，从最初在他NeXT机器上用shell脚本创建arXiv，到如今成为托管数百万篇论文的关键基础设施。文章重点介绍了关键时刻，例如埃德·威滕等有影响力人物的早期采用，以及确保非独家发行权的战略决策，从而防止出版商将其关闭。

尽管取得了成功，arXiv也面临着挑战，包括规模扩展问题、低质量提交的审核以及官僚障碍。金斯帕格被描述为一个才华横溢但非常规的人物，他仍然深度参与其中，不断寻求改进平台的方法，包括使用人工智能开发“民科过滤器”。本文强调了arXiv在加速科学进步方面的关键作用，尤其是在像新冠疫情这样的危机期间，以及它作为前沿研究的主要来源的持续重要性。

title: X-Ray Defence
summary:
This article, "X-Ray Defence: Hidden Resource, Sudden Lifeline," explores the defensive applications of the X-ray motif in chess. It's a follow-up to a previous article on X-ray attacks, and it focuses on how a piece can indirectly defend a square or piece through the body of another piece.

The author argues that defensive tactics are often overlooked but are crucial for chess improvement. They provide six examples of increasing difficulty where an X-ray defense is the key to saving an otherwise losing position. These examples illustrate how a piece seemingly out of play can contribute defensively by eyeing a crucial square through another piece.

The article emphasizes the importance of recognizing indirect lines of sight and considering all possible moves, even seemingly backward or unconventional ones. It also touches upon how defensive X-rays can sometimes lead to counterattacks and winning advantages.

The author encourages readers to revisit the article and the previous one on X-ray attacks to better internalize the motif. They also recommend exploring related tactical themes like crosspins and hidden moves on empty squares. The article concludes by inviting readers to visit the author's chess blog for more tactical and strategic lessons.
chinese_title: X射线防御
chinese_summary:
X射线防御：隐藏的资源，突现的生机

本文“X射线防御：隐藏的资源，突现的生机”探讨了X射线主题在国际象棋中的防御应用。它是之前一篇关于X射线攻击文章的后续，重点关注棋子如何通过另一棋子的身体间接防御一个格子或棋子。

作者认为防御战术常常被忽视，但对于提高棋艺至关重要。他们提供了六个难度递增的例子，其中X射线防御是挽救原本失败局面的关键。这些例子说明了看似不在行动范围内的棋子如何通过穿透另一棋子来观察关键格子，从而做出防御贡献。

文章强调了识别间接视线和考虑所有可能的走法（即使是看似后退或非常规的走法）的重要性。它还涉及防御性X射线有时如何导致反击和赢得优势。

作者鼓励读者重温本文和之前关于X射线攻击的文章，以便更好地内化这种主题。他们还建议探索相关的战术主题，如交叉牵制和空格上的隐藏棋步。文章最后邀请读者访问作者的国际象棋博客，以获取更多战术和战略课程。

title: Signal Carnival
summary:
"Signal Carnival" for the C64 cleverly swaps the audio and video cables, producing meaningful audio from the video signal and video from the audio signal, a novel approach.

Audio is driven by the VIC chip's frequency (7.9Mhz) and writing values via the 6502 processor at 246kHz. The demo leverages two timers to create a waveform, adjusted per frame, writing the resulting brightness value to the screen color register ($d020). This eats up all four timers, thus uses the lightpen circuitry for video stabilization. The music is a single voice that switches often to create a polyphonic sound.

Video is generated using the SID chip. The volume register ($d418) provides instant output, ideal for video generation. However, the signal goes through an analog bandpass filter, creating blurry, wide pixels. The demo adapts by using the x-axis for elements like textures that can tolerate blurring. Vanilla video bitbanging is used, with precise timing for horizontal syncs to avoid confusion with vertical syncs. The horizontal frequency is tweaked (64 cycles) instead of the standard 63.

The demo also features a custom loader that maintains audio during loading, decrunching and data transfer, and performs on-the-fly GCR decoding. The loader is a one-off and lacks features like loading from higher tracks or checksumming. A solver generates the decoding tables, a tool the author plans to release.
chinese_title: 信号嘉年华
chinese_summary:
C64上的“信号嘉年华”巧妙地交换了音频和视频线，从视频信号产生有意义的音频，并从音频信号产生视频，这是一种新颖的方法。

音频由VIC芯片的频率（7.9Mhz）驱动，并通过6502处理器以246kHz写入值。该演示利用两个定时器创建一个波形，每帧调整一次，并将产生的亮度值写入屏幕颜色寄存器（$d020）。这占用了所有四个定时器，因此使用光笔电路进行视频稳定。音乐是单音，但频繁切换以创造复音效果。

视频是使用SID芯片生成的。音量寄存器（$d418）提供即时输出，非常适合视频生成。然而，信号会通过一个模拟带通滤波器，产生模糊、宽大的像素。该演示通过使用x轴来呈现诸如可以容忍模糊的纹理等元素来适应这一点。采用原始的视频位操作，并使用精确的水平同步时间来避免与垂直同步混淆。水平频率被调整（64个周期），而不是标准的63个周期。

该演示还具有一个自定义加载器，可以在加载、解压缩和数据传输期间保持音频，并执行即时GCR解码。该加载器是一次性的，缺乏从更高磁道加载或校验和等功能。一个求解器生成解码表，作者计划发布此工具。

title: Ubuntu 25.04 "Plucky Puffin" Takes Flight
summary:
Ubuntu 25.04 "Plucky Puffin" has been officially released, bringing a range of improvements and new features to the popular Linux distribution. Key highlights include the GNOME 48 desktop environment with smoother animations thanks to dynamic triple buffering in Mutter, and a "Wellbeing Panel" and "Preserve Battery Health" mode. The Nautilus file manager is also faster, especially with large folders.

Under the hood, Ubuntu 25.04 uses Linux kernel 6.14, enhancing hardware support, energy efficiency, and security. Gaming gets a boost via the NTSYNC driver for Wine/Proton. The installer offers a more seamless experience, particularly for dual-booting with Windows.

While Ubuntu still offers a minimal set of default apps, it now includes Papers PDF reader. Networking and identity management improvements include secure time sync with Network Time Security (NTS) and better Active Directory integration.

A significant addition is "devpacks," snap bundles for popular frameworks like Go and Spring, alongside updated toolchains for Python, Rust, .NET, LLVM, and OpenJDK.

Official Ubuntu flavors like Kubuntu, Xubuntu, and Ubuntu MATE have also been updated. Support for 25.04 releases lasts nine months, with long-term support available through Ubuntu 24.04. The article concludes with hardware recommendations and a simplified installation guide.
chinese_title: Ubuntu 25.04 “快乐海鹦” 起飞
chinese_summary:
Ubuntu 25.04 “Plucky Puffin” 正式发布，为这款流行的 Linux 发行版带来了一系列改进和新功能。主要亮点包括采用 Mutter 中动态三重缓冲实现的更流畅动画的 GNOME 48 桌面环境，以及“健康面板”和“保持电池健康”模式。Nautilus 文件管理器也更快，尤其是在处理大型文件夹时。

在底层，Ubuntu 25.04 使用 Linux kernel 6.14，增强了硬件支持、能源效率和安全性。通过 Wine/Proton 的 NTSYNC 驱动程序，游戏性能得到提升。安装程序提供了更无缝的体验，尤其是在与 Windows 双启动时。

虽然 Ubuntu 仍然提供最少的默认应用程序，但现在包含了 Papers PDF 阅读器。网络和身份管理方面的改进包括使用网络时间安全协议（NTS）的安全时间同步以及更好的 Active Directory 集成。

一个重要的补充是“devpacks”，它是针对 Go 和 Spring 等流行框架的 snap 软件包，以及针对 Python、Rust、.NET、LLVM 和 OpenJDK 的更新工具链。

Kubuntu、Xubuntu 和 Ubuntu MATE 等官方 Ubuntu 衍生版本也已更新。对 25.04 版本的支持将持续九个月，长期支持可通过 Ubuntu 24.04 获得。文章最后提供了硬件建议和一个简化的安装指南。

title: The Joy of Linux Theming in the Age of Bootable Containers
summary:
In "The Joy of Linux Theming in the Age of Bootable Containers," the author explores the benefits of using bootable containers, specifically bootc, for Linux theming and customization. Frustrated by the instability of traditional methods, the author found that bootc, which defines the operating system as a Containerfile, offers a reliable and easily revertible way to experiment with themes and configurations. Changes are made in a container, built, and then switched to, allowing for safe testing and easy rollback if necessary.

While alternative methods exist, such as shell scripts, systemd-sysext, and Nix, bootc is praised for its flexibility, tooling support, safety, and reliability, making it difficult to break the /usr directory. Development Mode further enhances the workflow by providing a temporary writable overlayfs for quick testing.

The author then delves into the blurring lines of what constitutes a "Linux distribution" in the age of bootable containers, using their own Blue95 project as an example. Projects like Project Bluefin and Bazzite, built on bootc, are often called distributions, yet the distinction is becoming increasingly murky. Ultimately, the author argues that the creation of bootable containers, even for simple customizations like themes, can bring joy and allows for a personalized and creative computing experience.
chinese_title: 可启动容器时代 Linux 主题的乐趣
chinese_summary:
在“可启动容器时代 Linux 主题美化的乐趣”一文中，作者探讨了使用可启动容器，特别是 bootc，进行 Linux 主题美化和定制的好处。作者对传统方法的不稳定性感到沮丧，发现 bootc 将操作系统定义为 Containerfile，提供了一种可靠且易于恢复的方式来试验主题和配置。更改在容器中进行、构建，然后切换到该容器，从而实现安全测试并在必要时轻松回滚。

虽然存在替代方法，例如 shell 脚本、systemd-sysext 和 Nix，但 bootc 因其灵活性、工具支持、安全性和可靠性而备受赞誉，使得破坏 /usr 目录变得困难。开发模式通过提供临时的可写 overlayfs 来进行快速测试，从而进一步增强了工作流程。

作者随后深入探讨了在可启动容器时代，构成“Linux 发行版”的界限变得模糊的问题，并以他们自己的 Blue95 项目为例。像 Project Bluefin 和 Bazzite 这样基于 bootc 构建的项目通常被称为发行版，但这种区别正变得越来越模糊。最终，作者认为，创建可启动容器，即使是像主题这样简单的定制，也能带来乐趣，并实现个性化和创造性的计算体验。

title: Decomposing Transactional Systems
summary:
This article dissects transactional systems by breaking them down into four fundamental steps: execution, ordering, validation, and persistence. It emphasizes that while all transactional systems perform these steps, the order and concurrency in which they are executed lead to different tradeoffs and architectural designs.

The author then examines three real-world database systems: FoundationDB, Spanner, and TAPIR, to illustrate how these steps manifest in practice. FoundationDB is presented as a classic optimistic concurrency control database where transactions are executed, a commit version is acquired, conflicts are checked, and finally, the transaction is made durable.

Spanner is characterized as a pessimistic concurrency control database. It intertwines execution and validation with read locks acquired during transaction execution. Writes are buffered, and two-phase commit is used to validate across participants before determining the final commit version and making the transaction durable. Locks are then released. Despite its complexity, Spanner is viewed as fundamentally similar to a SERIALIZABLE MySQL.

TAPIR, designed for improved latency and throughput, is described as executing transactions, proposing a commit timestamp, performing concurrent validation on replicas, and then committing or aborting based on the consensus of the replicas.

The article concludes by showing that even complex distributed databases can be understood by decomposing their transaction processing into the core elements of execution, ordering, validation, and persistence, enabling a clearer understanding of their architectures and design choices.
chinese_title: 分解事务系统
chinese_summary:
本文通过将事务系统分解为执行、排序、验证和持久化四个基本步骤，剖析了事务系统。它强调，虽然所有事务系统都执行这些步骤，但它们的执行顺序和并发性会导致不同的权衡和架构设计。

作者随后考察了三个真实世界的数据库系统：FoundationDB、Spanner 和 TAPIR，以说明这些步骤如何在实践中体现。FoundationDB 被描述为一个经典的乐观并发控制数据库，事务被执行，获取提交版本，检查冲突，最后，事务变得持久。

Spanner 被描述为一个悲观并发控制数据库。它将执行和验证与事务执行期间获取的读锁交织在一起。写入被缓冲，并使用两阶段提交在参与者之间进行验证，然后确定最终的提交版本并使事务持久。然后释放锁。尽管很复杂，但 Spanner 被认为在根本上类似于 SERIALIZABLE MySQL。

TAPIR 旨在提高延迟和吞吐量，它被描述为执行事务，提出提交时间戳，对副本执行并发验证，然后根据副本的共识提交或中止。

文章最后表明，即使是复杂的分布式数据库，也可以通过将其事务处理分解为执行、排序、验证和持久化这些核心要素来理解，从而更清楚地了解它们的架构和设计选择。

title: Healthy soil is the hidden ingredient
summary:
This article highlights the critical importance of healthy soil, particularly in the European Union where 60-70% of soils are considered unhealthy, leading to significant economic and health costs. Spain, facing severe soil degradation, is a key focus. The article features Jesús Rodrigo Comino, a geographer researching sustainable soil management practices in Spanish vineyards. He utilizes geographical mapping systems and artificial intelligence to help farmers make informed decisions about irrigation, cover crops, and tillage to prevent soil erosion.

Rodrigo Comino is involved in the SOILCRATES project, part of the EU's "A Soil Deal for Europe" initiative, which aims to create collaborative field sites where scientists, farmers, and policymakers can experiment and promote sustainable soil practices. The project emphasizes educating the public about the vital role of healthy soils.

Climate change exacerbates soil degradation through increased temperatures, reduced precipitation, and more frequent extreme rainfall events. These changes are impacting Spanish vineyards, causing earlier flowering and increased soil erosion. While specific data on climate change's effects on vineyards is still being collected, the trends are evident, urging the need for immediate and comprehensive action to protect and improve soil health.
chinese_title: 健康的土壤是隐藏的要素。
chinese_summary:
本文强调了健康土壤的关键重要性，尤其是在欧盟，那里60-70%的土壤被认为是不健康的，导致了巨大的经济和健康成本。西班牙面临严重的土壤退化，是一个重点关注的国家。本文介绍了赫苏斯·罗德里戈·科米诺，一位研究西班牙葡萄园可持续土壤管理实践的地理学家。他利用地理测绘系统和人工智能来帮助农民就灌溉、覆盖作物和耕作做出明智的决策，以防止土壤侵蚀。

罗德里戈·科米诺参与了SOILCRATES项目，该项目是欧盟“欧洲土壤协议”倡议的一部分，旨在创建合作田间试验点，科学家、农民和政策制定者可以在这里试验和推广可持续土壤实践。该项目强调教育公众了解健康土壤的重要作用。

气候变化通过气温升高、降水减少和更频繁的极端降雨事件加剧了土壤退化。这些变化正在影响西班牙的葡萄园，导致更早的开花和土壤侵蚀加剧。虽然关于气候变化对葡萄园影响的具体数据仍在收集，但趋势已经很明显，这促使人们需要立即采取全面行动来保护和改善土壤健康。

title: Show HN: Keep your PyTorch model in VRAM by hot swapping code
summary:
This "Show HN" post introduces a method for hot-swapping PyTorch training code without unloading large models from VRAM, significantly reducing development time. Loading large language models can take a considerable amount of time (e.g., 30 seconds), making iterative development slow. The solution involves running training code in a separate background process using Python's `eval()`. This background process persists even after the main training script exits, keeping the model in VRAM. When the training script is run again, the model is immediately available.

The system uses a client-server architecture. The `model_server.py` script hosts the model and executes code sent by the `client.py` script. This enables remote code execution, potentially addressing issues with remote SSH interpreters like those in IntelliJ. The server also supports integrating DearImgui Python bindings, allowing users to build UIs for monitoring training progress and evaluating models, which are then loaded instantly when the script runs.

The post provides instructions for replacing the standard `.from_pretrained` call with a global variable reference to 'model' managed by the server. The server must be launched first, followed by submitting training code to it via the client.

The author cautions that this approach introduces a security risk due to the execution of arbitrary code and advises against exposing the server directly to the internet.
chinese_title: Show HN: 热插拔代码，让你的PyTorch模型留在VRAM中
chinese_summary:
这个"Show HN"帖子介绍了一种热插拔PyTorch训练代码的方法，无需从VRAM卸载大型模型，从而显著缩短开发时间。加载大型语言模型可能需要相当长的时间（例如，30秒），导致迭代开发速度缓慢。该解决方案涉及使用Python的`eval()`在单独的后台进程中运行训练代码。即使主训练脚本退出，此后台进程仍然存在，使模型保留在VRAM中。当再次运行训练脚本时，模型可以立即使用。

title: Falsify: Hypothesis-Inspired Shrinking for Haskell (2023)
summary:
This article introduces falsify, a new Haskell library for property-based testing inspired by Hypothesis, focusing on its unique approach to shrinking. Unlike unit testing, property-based testing uses randomly generated inputs and verifies properties. Shrinking is crucial for finding minimal, relevant counter-examples when tests fail.

Falsify differs from QuickCheck by shrinking the stream of random samples rather than the generated values themselves, following Hypothesis' lead. However, falsify uses infinite sample trees instead of Hypothesis' linear sample streams. This means that instead of multiple shrinking passes (like in Hypothesis), falsify performs a single pass, shrinking individual samples in the tree. This choice leads to more predictable shrinking behavior. Because monadic binds split the sample tree, int is guaranteed to be unaffected by the behavior of list. This is unlike Hypothesis-style shrinking.

The use of sample trees in falsify has two key consequences: how the sample tree is shrunk (using a partial ordering and a single pass), and how samples are distributed to parsers (via tree splitting during composition with applicative <*> or monadic >>=).

Falsify's design avoids the limitations of integrated shrinking (used by QuickCheck and Hedgehog) regarding monadic binds, allowing independent shrinking of generators on both sides of a `(>>=)` operation. This allows falsify to shrink element values in list before going back and shrinking the list length. This approach leads to more predictable and understandable shrinking behavior compared to stream-based approaches, ultimately aiding in debugging.

Falsify 不同于 QuickCheck 的地方在于，它遵循 Hypothesis 的做法，缩减的是随机样本流，而不是生成的实际值。然而，falsify 使用无限样本树，而不是 Hypothesis 的线性样本流。这意味着，falsify 执行单次遍历，缩减树中的单个样本，而不是像 Hypothesis 那样进行多次缩减。这种选择带来了更可预测的缩减行为。由于单子绑定会分割样本树，因此 int 保证不受 list 行为的影响。这与 Hypothesis 风格的缩减不同。

在 Falsify 中使用样本树有两个关键后果：样本树如何缩减（使用偏序和单次遍历），以及样本如何通过与 applicative <*> 或 monadic >>= 组合期间的树分裂分发给解析器。

Falsify 的设计避免了集成缩减（QuickCheck 和 Hedgehog 使用）在单子绑定方面的限制，允许 `(>>=)` 操作两侧的生成器进行独立缩减。这使得 falsify 可以在返回并缩减列表长度之前缩减列表中的元素值。与基于流的方法相比，这种方法带来了更可预测和可理解的缩减行为，最终有助于调试。

title: Better Error Handling
summary:
This article discusses the challenges of error handling in TypeScript and JavaScript, highlighting the limitations of the traditional `try/catch` method, particularly in complex applications. While familiar, `try/catch` lacks type safety (caught errors are often typed as `unknown`) and integration with the type system, making it difficult to guarantee correct error handling and identify potential issues like the bug on line 43 that throwed error that does not have `.message`.

The article proposes two modern approaches: Go-style return tuples and Monadic-style Result types.

*   **Go-style tuples** return either the result or an error, offering simplicity but requiring eager error handling and potentially verbose code.
*   **Monadic Result types** (e.g., using libraries like neverthrow) treat errors as values within a container, allowing for chaining and lazy evaluation but introducing a steeper learning curve and more complex API.

The author acknowledges that `try/catch` can be sufficient for simpler frontend applications, especially with libraries like tanstack/query or apolloClient handling network errors. However, the Go-style and Monadic approaches provide better type safety and control flow management for more complex scenarios.

The article also emphasizes the cognitive burden of adopting paradigm-shifting libraries like Effect, cautioning organizations to fully commit and prepare for a learning curve similar to adopting a new programming language.

Finally, it raises the issue that returning error as value makes it difficult to identify where the error may comes from using stack trace.
chinese_title: 更好的错误处理
chinese_summary:
本文探讨了 TypeScript 和 JavaScript 中错误处理的挑战，强调了传统 `try/catch` 方法的局限性，尤其是在复杂应用程序中。尽管 `try/catch` 很常用，但它缺乏类型安全（捕获的错误通常被类型化为 `unknown`）以及与类型系统的集成，这使得难以保证正确的错误处理，并识别潜在问题，例如第 43 行上的错误，该错误抛出的错误没有 `.message` 属性。

本文提出了两种现代方法：Go 风格的返回元组和 Monadic 风格的 Result 类型。

*   **Go 风格的元组** 返回结果或错误，提供了简单性，但需要积极的错误处理并可能导致代码冗长。
*   **Monadic Result 类型**（例如，使用像 neverthrow 这样的库）将错误视为容器中的值，允许链式调用和延迟评估，但引入了更陡峭的学习曲线和更复杂的 API。

作者承认，`try/catch` 对于较简单的前端应用程序可能足够，尤其是在像 tanstack/query 或 apolloClient 这样的库处理网络错误的情况下。然而，Go 风格和 Monadic 方法为更复杂的场景提供了更好的类型安全性和控制流管理。

本文还强调了采用像 Effect 这样改变范式的库的认知负担，告诫组织要完全投入并为类似于采用新编程语言的学习曲线做好准备。

title: Pushing the Limits of LLM Quantization via the Linearity Theorem
summary:
This paper introduces a novel approach to large language model (LLM) quantization based on a "linearity theorem" that establishes a direct relationship between layer-wise reconstruction error (specifically, the $\ell_2$ error) and the increase in model perplexity caused by quantization. This theorem offers a theoretical justification for layer-wise quantization strategies, a departure from the empirical approach prevalent in current methods.

The authors leverage this theorem to develop two key applications:

1.  **HIGGS (Hadamard-Inspired Grids for Quantization):** A data-free quantization method that uses Hadamard rotations and MSE-optimal grids. HIGGS outperforms existing data-free quantization techniques, including the widely used NF4 format.

2.  **Optimal Non-Uniform Quantization:** A solution for finding the optimal non-uniform per-layer quantization levels that satisfy a given compression constraint in the medium-bitwidth regime. This solution is obtained by reducing the problem to dynamic programming.

The paper demonstrates the effectiveness of these methods through experiments on Llama-3.1, Llama-3.2, and Qwen models. Results indicate improved accuracy-compression trade-offs compared to previous approaches. Furthermore, the authors highlight the efficient GPU kernel support for their method, facilitating both data-free and non-uniform quantization for LLMs. Overall, this work provides a theoretical foundation and practical advancements in LLM quantization, leading to better compression and performance.
chinese_title: 通过线性定理突破LLM量化的极限

作者利用该定理开发了两个关键应用：

1. **HIGGS（用于量化的 Hadamard 启发网格）：** 一种使用 Hadamard 旋转和 MSE 最优网格的无数据量化方法。HIGGS 优于现有的无数据量化技术，包括广泛使用的 NF4 格式。

2. **最优非均匀量化：** 一种用于寻找满足中等位宽范围内的给定压缩约束的最优非均匀逐层量化级别的解决方案。该解决方案通过将问题简化为动态规划获得。

本文通过对 Llama-3.1、Llama-3.2 和 Qwen 模型进行的实验证明了这些方法的有效性。结果表明，与以往的方法相比，精度-压缩权衡有所改善。此外，作者强调了其方法的高效 GPU 内核支持，从而促进了 LLM 的无数据和非均匀量化。总而言之，这项工作为 LLM 量化提供了理论基础和实践进步，从而实现了更好的压缩和性能。

title: New Proof Settles Decades-Old Bet About Connected Networks
summary:
This article recounts the story of a decades-old bet between mathematicians Noga Alon and Peter Sarnak regarding the prevalence of optimal expander graphs, known as Ramanujan graphs, within the broader category of regular graphs. Alon believed Ramanujan graphs would be common in random graphs, while Sarnak argued they would be rare, requiring complicated constructions.

The article explains the significance of expander graphs, their use in modeling various systems, and the importance of the "Alon-Boppana bound" in defining optimal expanders. It then details how Sarnak and collaborators were able to construct Ramanujan graphs using number theory.

After decades of debate, mathematicians Jiaoyang Huang, Theo McKenzie, and Horng-Tzer Yau finally resolved the bet. By extending the universality conjecture (originally conceived by physicist Eugene Wigner regarding random matrices) to the eigenvalues of adjacency matrices of random regular graphs, they precisely determined the distribution of eigenvalues. Their calculations revealed that approximately 69% of random regular graphs are Ramanujan, meaning neither Alon nor Sarnak was entirely correct. The article highlights the difficulty of the problem, the unexpected connection to physics, and the impact of the proof on our understanding of random matrices and graph theory.
chinese_title: 新证明解决了关于连接网络的数十年之久的赌局

本文解释了扩展图的重要意义，它们在各种系统建模中的应用，以及“Alon-Boppana界”在定义最优扩展器中的重要性。然后详细介绍了Sarnak及其合作者如何利用数论构建拉马努金图。

经过数十年的争论，数学家黄家阳、Theo McKenzie和姚鸿泽最终解决了这个赌注。通过将普适性猜想（最初由物理学家尤金·维格纳针对随机矩阵提出）扩展到随机正则图的邻接矩阵的特征值，他们精确地确定了特征值的分布。他们的计算表明，大约69%的随机正则图是拉马努金图，这意味着Alon和Sarnak的观点都不是完全正确的。本文强调了问题的难度，与物理学的意外联系，以及该证明对我们理解随机矩阵和图论的影响。

title: The movie mistake mystery from "Revenge of the Sith"
summary:
Todd Vaziri's blog post delves into the mystery surrounding a fleeting "Force ghost" sighting in "Revenge of the Sith." He explores the phenomenon of movie mistakes, those glimpses behind the cinematic curtain that reveal the artistry and craft involved in filmmaking, citing examples from films like "Glory," "Goodfellas," "Aliens," "Duel," "The Dark Knight," and "The Abyss." He also laments the problematic trend of erasing these mistakes during film restoration projects, arguing it constitutes a form of revisionist history.

The core of the article focuses on a supposed "Force ghost" appearing briefly behind Anakin Skywalker in the Mustafar duel scene. Vaziri, a veteran of Industrial Light & Magic (ILM) who worked on the film, recounts how the internet became fascinated by this anomaly. Driven by curiosity and persistent online discussion, Vaziri embarked on a personal investigation, delving into ILM's archived footage.

After retrieving the original greenscreen plates, he discovered the "Force ghost" was actually a stunt rigger in a peculiar shirt, manually operating the lava skiff. The rigger's image slipped through during the compositing process, where the artist was refining the edges of the greenscreen extraction. Despite multiple levels of review, the mistake went unnoticed until eagle-eyed viewers spotted it years later. Vaziri concludes that this "mistake" is a testament to the handmade nature of visual effects and an endearing part of ILM's history. He emphasizes that "perfect is the enemy of good" and that these small imperfections contribute to the charm of cinema.

title: How Thai authorities use online doxxing to suppress dissent
summary:
This article details "JUICYJAM," a sustained, coordinated social media harassment and doxxing campaign targeting the Thai pro-democracy movement, operating since at least August 2020. Researchers attribute the campaign to the Royal Thai Armed Forces and/or the Royal Thai Police, based on leaked confidential documents from March 2025. The operation utilizes an inauthentic persona, "Ms. Juk Khlong Sam," across platforms like X and Facebook to identify and expose pro-democracy protesters' personal information, urging followers to harass them and report them to the police.

JUICYJAM stands out as a successful state-sponsored influence operation due to its high follower count and engagement. It operates within a larger context of online and offline suppression tactics targeting dissent in Thailand, similar to those seen in Hong Kong. The report highlights social media platforms' shortcomings in addressing coordinated doxxing campaigns designed to suppress civil society, especially considering state sponsorship and the context of unrest.

The article details JUICYJAM's timeline, beginning with two blogs in August 2020 and subsequently expanding to multiple platforms, including X, Facebook (groups and pages), Instagram, TikTok, Telegram, and Threads. While core activities focus on the X profile and Facebook Group, "unofficial" Facebook Pages amplify the same harassing content. The leaked documents reveal JUICYJAM as part of a deliberate strategy to suppress protest groups and narratives through aggressive tactics.

title: A 1980s toy robot arm inspired modern robotics
summary:
This article explores the legacy of the Armatron, a 1980s toy robotic arm, and its surprising influence on modern robotics. The author, reminiscing about his childhood fascination with the toy, connects with its inventor, Hiroyuki Watanabe, a retired engineer from Tomy (now Takara Tomy).

Watanabe reveals that the Armatron, despite its impressive functionality, was entirely mechanical, a feat of complex gearbox design. Inspired by a newspaper clipping and radio-controlled helicopters, Watanabe's invention provided six degrees of movement controlled by twin joysticks.

The Armatron gained unexpected recognition from robotics engineers and university researchers. The article highlights the experiences of Adam Borrell, a mechanical design engineer at Boston Dynamics, and Eric Paulos, a UC Berkeley professor of electrical engineering and computer science, who were both inspired by the toy as children. Borrell was fascinated by the mechanical gear train while Paulos was enamored with the exploration of picking stuff up and moving it around.

The article draws parallels between the mechanical challenges posed by the Armatron and current research in AI-powered robotics, such as object manipulation and gripping techniques. Ultimately, the Armatron encouraged kids to explore analog mechanics, and Watanabe expresses joy at seeing its continued rediscovery and modification by a new generation of fans. The article concludes by highlighting that AI may be taking over the world of robotics, the field still requires engineers who can problem-solve in the physical world.
chinese_title: 一个80年代的玩具机械臂启发了现代机器人技术。
chinese_summary:
本文探讨了20世纪80年代玩具机械臂阿玛创（Armatron）的遗产，以及它对现代机器人技术的惊人影响。作者回忆起童年时期对该玩具的迷恋，并联系了它的发明者渡边博幸，一位来自多美（现为Takara Tomy）的退休工程师。

渡边透露，阿玛创尽管功能强大，但完全是机械的，是复杂齿轮箱设计的壮举。受报纸剪报和无线电遥控直升机的启发，渡边的发明提供了由双操纵杆控制的六个自由度。

阿玛创出乎意料地获得了机器人工程师和大学研究人员的认可。文章重点介绍了波士顿动力公司的机械设计工程师亚当·博雷尔和加州大学伯克利分校的电气工程和计算机科学教授埃里克·保卢斯，他们小时候都受到了该玩具的启发。博雷尔对机械齿轮传动装置着迷，而保卢斯则沉迷于探索捡起东西并移动它们的过程。

文章将阿玛创带来的机械挑战与当前人工智能驱动的机器人研究（如物体操作和抓取技术）进行了比较。最终，阿玛创鼓励孩子们探索模拟力学，渡边表示很高兴看到新一代粉丝不断重新发现和改进它。文章最后强调，虽然人工智能可能正在接管机器人领域，但该领域仍然需要能够在物理世界中解决问题的工程师。

title: Digital piracy in times of Covid-19
summary:
This article, "Digital piracy in times of Covid-19", investigates how the pandemic affected the consumption of cultural goods (music, films/series, games, and books), focusing on the shift between legal and illegal consumption and the relationship between digital piracy and legal sales. The study uses data from a 2022 consumer survey across 14 countries.

Key findings include: a 6-8% surge in "new pirates" during the pandemic, primarily driven by income reductions and increased time at home due to remote work/schooling. Among adults, these disruptions correlated with a decline in legal sales of music and games. Conversely, decreased legal audiovisual consumption was only seen among adults working in person. Minors exhibited different patterns, showing a negative association between illegal consumption and legal book consumption but a positive link with legal audiovisual consumption.

The study identifies a "curfew effect" (more time/budget for cultural goods) and an "income effect" (decreased ability to pay for legal content) as key drivers. It uses an instrumental variable approach (attitudes towards victimless crimes) to address endogeneity when examining the displacement of legal consumption by piracy. While acknowledging limitations in completely eliminating endogeneity, the research provides valuable insights into how pandemic-related shocks influenced consumer behavior regarding cultural goods and piracy.

title: Molecules that fight infection also act on the brain
summary:
Two new studies from MIT and Harvard Medical School reveal that the immune molecule IL-17 acts on the brain to influence behavior during illness. Researchers found that IL-17 impacts two distinct brain regions: the amygdala and the somatosensory cortex, resulting in divergent effects. In the amygdala, IL-17 induces anxiety by increasing neuronal excitability, while in the somatosensory cortex, specifically the S1DZ region, it promotes sociable behavior by decreasing neuronal excitability.

These findings suggest a tight interconnection between the immune and nervous systems. IL-17, initially thought to solely serve an immune function, appears to act as a neuromodulator in the brain, regulating neuronal activity. This role might have evolved earlier and was later co-opted by the immune system.

The study also found that blocking IL-17 receptors in the amygdala paradoxically increased IL-17C levels, potentially explaining adverse mental health effects observed in a clinical trial for psoriasis treatment. This suggests that IL-17's influence on anxiety during infection could be a beneficial response to promote isolation and prevent the spread of illness.

The researchers emphasize that the discovery of IL-17's diverse effects in different brain regions could lead to new therapeutic approaches for neurological conditions like autism and depression, by targeting the immune system to influence brain function.

chinese_summary:
麻省理工学院和哈佛医学院的两项新研究表明，免疫分子IL-17作用于大脑，影响疾病期间的行为。研究人员发现，IL-17影响两个不同的脑区：杏仁核和体感皮层，导致不同的影响。在杏仁核中，IL-17通过增加神经元兴奋性来诱发焦虑，而在体感皮层，特别是S1DZ区域，它通过降低神经元兴奋性来促进社交行为。

这些发现表明免疫系统和神经系统之间存在紧密的相互联系。IL-17最初被认为仅具有免疫功能，但现在看来它在大脑中充当神经调节剂，调节神经元活动。这种作用可能进化得更早，后来被免疫系统所利用。

该研究还发现，阻断杏仁核中的IL-17受体反而会增加IL-17C的水平，这可能解释了在银屑病治疗的临床试验中观察到的不良精神健康影响。这表明IL-17对感染期间焦虑的影响可能是一种有益的反应，旨在促进隔离并防止疾病传播。

研究人员强调，发现IL-17在不同脑区具有多样化的影响，可能通过靶向免疫系统来影响大脑功能，从而为自闭症和抑郁症等神经系统疾病带来新的治疗方法。

title: Raspberry Pi Lidar Scanner
summary:
The PiLiDAR project details a DIY 360° 3D panorama scanner built around a Raspberry Pi. It uses an LDRobot LD06, LD19, or STL27L LiDAR for distance measurements and a Raspberry Pi HQ camera with a fisheye lens for capturing panoramic images. A NEMA17 stepper motor, controlled by an A4988 driver, rotates the scanner.

Key features include a custom LiDAR serial driver with CRC check, hardware PWM calibration, 2D live visualization, 6K 360° panorama stitching using Hugin, and 3D scene assembly from 2D planes, visualized and exported using Open3D. It also allows for alignment of multiple scans using global registration and ICP.

The project outlines hardware specifications, wiring diagrams, and detailed setup instructions for components like the power button, accelerometer, CPU fan, scan button, and UART. It covers software installation and configuration for hardware PWM, panorama stitching, remote Jupyter access, and USB storage dumping. The guide also addresses troubleshooting common issues like Windows serial driver problems, RPi.GPIO errors, VS Code performance, and pye57 installation. Finally, references to related projects, tutorials, and demo data are provided.

title: Perplexingly Book-Learned Emacs
summary:
The author explores using the Perplexity AI LLM to identify new books by favorite authors, addressing the challenge of distinguishing new works from reprints or editions. They created a simple Emacs library, `perplexity.el`, to interact with the Perplexity API. While Perplexity successfully lists an author's books, its responses are inconsistent and sometimes hallucinatory.

The author experimented with prompts like listing "missing books" (books by an author they don't own), with mixed results; Amy Hempel's books were accurately identified, while Megan Whalen Turner's weren't. Response times were also variable. Despite these limitations, the author found the tool useful enough to impulse-buy fifteen books during testing, integrating commands to browse books on Bookshop.org and verify their existence on Goodreads.

The author then attempts to query Perplexity for books released by multiple tracked authors in recent years, encountering limitations in the number of searches Perplexity is willing to perform in a single request. They plan to loop through each author individually to aggregate results.

Finally, the author compared Perplexity's performance with Gemini and OpenAI in listing missing books by David Sedaris, finding no significant improvement in the other LLMs. The author concludes that, despite its jankiness and limitations, the LLM shows potential for tracking new releases from favorite authors.

title: Taking Notes with Joplin
summary:
This article reviews Joplin, an open-source, multi-platform note-taking application. Joplin supports Markdown and Rich Text editing, multimedia attachments, and offers synchronization across devices with end-to-end encryption via services like Nextcloud, WebDAV, Dropbox, OneDrive, or Joplin Cloud (paid). It also allows local filesystem synchronization.

The interface is a three-pane layout with notebooks, note lists, and an editor/viewer. Joplin has task management capabilities, multi-window support (since v3.2), customizable themes, and a plugin system for extensibility, including drawing and OCR capabilities.

However, Joplin, being Electron-based, can have high resource consumption. Synchronization performance varies, and conflict resolution is limited. The WYSIWYG editor can be inconsistent with Markdown, and table editing is restricted. Development is active, with regular releases and community involvement. The article notes that Joplin's OCR isn't great for complex formats like tables and points out the need for improvement in handwritten text recognition.

title: Attention Spans for Math and Stories (2019)
summary:
This essay argues that storytelling is crucial for engaging children (and adults) with mathematics. The author contends that young children, while intelligent, often lack the innate curiosity needed for mathematical reasoning and persistence. Storytelling bridges this gap by providing a justification-free and engaging framework for abstract concepts.

The author illustrates this with anecdotes, including how a 5-year-old Hungarian girl grasped the concept of prime numbers after hearing about them in a story about Paul Erdős. They also recount using storytelling to motivate children at a summer camp, creating elaborate secret agent narratives that incorporated mathematical concepts and encouraged participation in activities.

The essay highlights how stories can normalize math, making it less scary and more accessible. Sharing positive stories about math or incorporating it into bedtime stories can counteract math anxiety. Ultimately, the author suggests that the best approach is to start with simple, story-driven examples and gradually transition to more mathematically focused content as the learner becomes more comfortable. They advocate for more story-focused content between basic number sense and undergraduate-level math, citing Numberphile and Beast Academy as good examples. The core idea is that math can grow naturally out of a story when presented with curiosity-inducing patterns.

chinese_summary:

作者用轶事来说明这一点，包括一位5岁的匈牙利女孩在听了关于保罗·埃尔德什的故事后，理解了素数的概念。他们还讲述了如何通过讲故事来激励夏令营的孩子们，创造精心设计的秘密特工故事，这些故事融入了数学概念，并鼓励孩子们参与活动。

本文强调了故事如何使数学正常化，使其不再那么可怕，也更容易理解。分享关于数学的积极故事或将其融入睡前故事可以抵消数学焦虑。最终，作者建议最好的方法是从简单、故事驱动的例子开始，并随着学习者逐渐适应，逐渐过渡到更以数学为中心的内容。他们倡导在基本的数字感知和本科水平的数学之间加入更多以故事为中心的内容，并以Numberphile和Beast Academy为例。核心思想是，当呈现出能引起好奇心的模式时，数学可以自然地从故事中产生。

title: Home galleries are hiding in plain sight across Canada
summary:
Across Canada, a growing trend of home galleries is emerging as artists and curators transform residential spaces into exhibition venues. Driven by rising living costs and a desire to create accessible art experiences, these unconventional galleries range from backyards and apartments to garages and even chicken coops.

Erin Storus's "Garden Variety" in Toronto exemplifies this trend, turning her backyard into a temporary art space during the pandemic. Similarly, Marie Ségolène Brault runs "Espace Maurice" out of her Montreal loft, and Danica Pinteric operates "Joys" from a renovated Toronto garage. These spaces foster community engagement and provide opportunities for emerging artists.

Other examples include "Beauty Supply," a gallery in Toronto artists Lisa Neighbour and Carlo Cesta's home, Bonny Poon's "Conditions" in her Toronto condo, Orchid Contemporary in a Hamilton garage and even a chicken coop turned gallery. These initiatives prioritize underrepresented artists and create welcoming environments for art lovers. Jay Isaac's new project space in Rowley, N.B., 13 Cedars is adding to the burgeoning contemporary-art scene in the region.

While foot traffic may be limited in some locations, like Alexander Rondeau's "Between Pheasants Contemporary" in rural Ontario or La Shed on Cape Breton Island, these home galleries cultivate local art scenes and connect with broader audiences online. They offer artists and curators agency, reduce costs, and foster a sense of community, enriching the Canadian art landscape.

title: First hormone-free male birth control pill enters human trials
summary:
Here's a summary of the article based on the title:

The article discusses a new male birth control pill that, unlike existing experimental options, is hormone-free and is entering human clinical trials. The key advantage of this approach is that it avoids the potential side effects associated with hormonal manipulation, such as mood swings, weight gain, and libido changes, which have hindered the development of effective and widely accepted male hormonal contraceptives.

The pill, reportedly 99% effective in preclinical studies (likely referring to animal trials), works by targeting and inhibiting a protein called α-receptor, critical for sperm fertility. By blocking this protein, the pill temporarily renders sperm unable to fertilize an egg. This effect is intended to be reversible, allowing men to regain their fertility after discontinuing the medication. The human trials will evaluate the drug's safety, tolerability, and efficacy in preventing pregnancy. The success of these trials could represent a significant breakthrough in male contraception, offering men a non-hormonal and reversible option to manage their fertility and more equally share the responsibility of family planning. The article likely emphasizes the unmet need for male contraceptive options beyond condoms and vasectomy, and highlights the potential impact of this new pill on global reproductive health.
